data.title: Alexander Armstrong TV Show/Series Credits
data.meta_description: TV Shows featuring Alexander Armstrong, listed alphabetically with photos when available. All of the TV programs that had Alexander Armstrong in the cast are ...
data.text:
TV Shows featuring Alexander Armstrong, listed alphabetically with photos when available. All of the TV programs that had Alexander Armstrong in the cast are featured here. Alexander Armstrong may have had a prominent role in these shows, but this list also includes shows where Alexander Armstrong had a guest starring role or cameo appearance. You can find additional information about these Alexander Armstrong shows as well, such as who else starred on the show and who created it.

The list you're viewing is made up of a variety of different shows, including The Sarah Jane Adventures and After You've Gone.

This list answers the questions, "What shows has Alexander Armstrong been on?" and "What are the best Alexander Armstrong TV shows?"

If you're a TV junkie, this list is the perfect resource for finding some new Alexander Armstrong shows that you haven't already seen. If you're going to waste time watching television you might as well do it while watching shows starring Alexander Armstrong. {#nodes}

Working in television has given Alexander Armstrong the opportunity to work with other great actors, including Martin Freeman and David Walliams.

A Town Called Panic

Alexander Armstrong

Premiered : 2003

A Town Called Panic is a 2000 puppetoon series distributed by Aardman Animations and produced in Belgium by Vincent Patar and Stéphane Aubier for La Parti & Pic Pic André. It follows the everyday events of Cowboy, Indian and Horse in a small rural town as they go about their lives. Each episode is roughly 5 minutes long and is crudely animated: the characters are meant to resemble cheap toy figurines. Some stations broadcast several episodes in a 15 or 30-minute block. A spinoff animated feature film called A Town Called Panic was completed in Spring 2009 and debuted at Cannes in May of the same year. A Town Called Panic is seen worldwide on channels such as ABC Rollercoaster in Australia, Nicktoons Network in the United States, EBS in South Korea, and Teletoon in Canada, and is available online at Atom Films. In the UK, A Town called Panic played on Nickelodeon. Much of the characters and scenery were later recycled for the Cravendale Milk adverts using a Pirate, a Cow and a bicyclist as the characters. In 2013, a half-hour Christmas Special was made, which received an English dub that aired on CBBC in 2014 under the title A Christmas Panic.

Nicholas Lyndhurst, Celia Imrie, Ryan Sampson

Premiered : 2007

After You've Gone was a British comedy that aired on BBC One from 12 January 2007 to 21 December 2008. Starring Nicholas Lyndhurst, Celia Imrie, Dani Harmer and Ryan Sampson, After You've Gone was created by Fred Barron, who also created My Family. The writers include Barron, Ian Brown, Katie Douglas, James Hendie, Danny Robins, Andrea Solomons and Dan Tetsell. Three series and two Christmas specials aired, and work on scripts for a fourth series had already begun when the BBC withdrew the commission in November 2008 and cancelled the series.

Alexander Armstrong's Big Ask

Alexander Armstrong, Dave Lamb

Premiered : 2011

Alexander Armstrong's Big Ask was a British comedy panel show hosted by Alexander Armstrong. The pilot was shown on Dave on 30 May 2011. The guests on the pilot were Robert Webb, Katy Brand and Griff Rhys Jones. After a positive reaction to the pilot, Dave ordered a full series which was filmed in October 2011 and broadcast from 6 February 2012. A second series began 26 February 2013.

Sarah Alexander, Emma Pierson, Alexander Armstrong

Premiered : 1997

Armstrong and Miller is a comedy sketch television show that aired between 1997 and 2001 featuring Alexander Armstrong and Ben Miller, known together as Armstrong and Miller. Following a series on the Paramount Comedy Channel in 1997, a further two were made for Channel 4. The duo moved to BBC One in 2007 with The Armstrong and Miller Show.

Premiered : 2009

Micro Men is a 2009 tv film directed by Saul Metzstein.

Emma Pierson, Alexander Armstrong, Doon Mackichan

Premiered : 2000

Beast is a BBC One sitcom based in a veterinary surgery. Two series of six episodes each were made, with the first broadcast in early 2000 and the second in early 2001. The main premise of the show is that the main character and practice owner does not like being a vet and has a strong dislike of animals.
